results.title: Not enough
results.creator_credit: Ben Haanstra Film Productions, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development and Wim Van Der Velde
results.brief_description: About responsibility to developing countries. The apathy in rich countries is contrasted with the misery and toil of people in poor countries such as India who are attempting to develop their natural resources. Population growth is seen to be greater than increases in food production.

results.title: Not Crippled, Not Useless
results.brief_description: Michael Briffa is fourteen and will probably be confined to a wheelchair for the rest of his life. This program explores Michael’s determination and success in being allowed to enrol in an ordinary school. As well, Michael’s parents discuss their attitudes to special schools.

results.title: Not by jeans alone
results.creator_credit: WGBH Educational Foundation, KTEH-TV (Television station : San Jose, Calif.) and Louise Henry
results.brief_description: Notes the market research into consumer behaviour that is carried out by the Levi company prior to the launching of a special range of tailored clothes for men. Shows the breakdown of the market into five distinct groups which have different reasons for purchasing clothes - eg status, work, and comfort; how the target group for the new range of clothes is determined; and how consumer discussion groups with members of this target group elicit their responses to the proposed range. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Not by choice
results.brief_description: A glimpse of Sydney’s soup-kitchens and the down-and-outs for whom they provide meals. This documentary film gives a glimpse of the institutions and of the lives of the men they assist. Its frankly emotional approach avoids any attempt to explain causes or to offer solutions. In fact it suggests that strong personal pride is characteristic of these men, and would prohibit any easy solution.

results.title: Not by books alone
results.brief_description: How people make use of the various community services made available by the local public library, including film and radio programs, concerts, art exhibitions and other special activities for children and teenagers. The library shown in the film is the Rochester Public Library, USA.

results.title: Not at random
results.brief_description: World population is now 3.6 billion. The human race has doubled its numbers since 1920. It may have doubled again by the end of the century. This is a report on the population problem in Southeast Asia showing the various dimensions of the problem, including the different attitudes of people in cities and rural areas toward birth control and family planning. A solution to the population crisis must be found before any real attempt can be made to overcome many of the major problems facing the world today so as to ensure the quality of life and social justice of all.

results.title: Not all pedestrians are people
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “B.P. Road Safety”.
Stresses that not all pedestrians are people! The driver should always give way to pedestrians and that includes people who are careless, children, animals and even the occasional duck! The good driver anticipates what pedestrians and animals may do, especially at night. Advises the rules which both drivers and pedestrians should follow in order to drive safely and avoid accidents.

results.title: Not a love story
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Dorothy Todd Henaut and Bonnie Sherr Klein
results.brief_description: A thought provoking chronicle of the odyssey of two women motivated by the desire to know more about pornography - why it exists, the forms it takes and how it affects the relations between men and women. It offers insights and perspective’s from men and women who earn their living from the porn trade, and from some of pornography’s most outspoken critics.

results.title: Not a bedroom war
results.creator_credit: Australia. Special Broadcasting Service, Anne Deveson Productions, Anne Deveson, Anna Grieve and Kay Pavlou
results.brief_description: A Global Forum of Women was held in Dublin in 1992, a gathering of women leaders from around the world, assessing together the gains already made by feminism and the ground still to be covered to eliminate prejudice against women. The women discussed the need for, and importance of, a diversity of women in positions of leadership to serve as role models, the problems of balancing career and family, and women as an economic and political force. Those interviewed include Mary Robinson, President of Ireland, Dr Anne Summers, women’s adviser to the Australian Prime Minister, Betty Friedan, author of “The Feminine Mystique”, Bella Abzug, former US Congresswoman, Devaki Jain, Indian economist, Dame Jocelyn Barrow, UK broadcaster, Iola Mathews of the ACTU, and Ruth Bamela Engo-Tjega from Cameroon who works for the UN.

results.title: Nostromo. Parts 1 & 2
results.creator_credit: Pixit, BBC, Radiotelevisione Italiana, Television Espanola, WGBH (Boston), Fernando Ghia and Alastair Reid
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Joseph Conrad, set in South America in the late 1880’s. An Englishman, Charles Gould, and his wife Emilia return to his childhood home to reopen his silver mine. Determined to make the mine succeed, he becomes involved in corruption, conspiracy and revolution. Gould becomes obsessed with saving the silver mine but there is only one man he can trust - Nostromo. Starring Colin Firth, Claudio Amendola, Lothaire Bluteau, Albert Finney, Claudia Cardinale and Brian Dennehy.
